snippet: The Israeli military said the soldier who had been thought captured by Palestinian militants during a deadly clash on Friday was now considered to have been killed in battle.
abstract: Israeli military says Second Lt Hadar Goldin, initially thought to be captured by Palestinian militants, is now considered to have been killed in battle; Goldin becomes latest flash point in conflict between Israel and Hamas, and his disappearance prompted Israeli bombardment of Gaza and calls from leaders around the world for his release.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Jerusalem, and Jodi Rudoren from Kfar Saba, Israel. Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza City, and Michael R. Gordon from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Israeli military said the soldier who had been thought captured by Palestinian militants during a deadly clash on Friday was now considered to have been killed in battle.

headline.main: Missing Soldier Killed in Battle, Israel Confirms
headline.print_headline: Missing Soldier Killed in Battle, Israel Confirms
